Metadata: Vertinoid polyketides from the saltwater culture of the fungus "Trichoderma longibrachiatum​" separated from a haliclona marine sponge

Metabolites discovered from the cultures of marine-derived fungi are either parallel or identical to those of terrestrial fungi. The authors began a study of the saltwater culture of a "Trichoderma longibrachiatum​" procured form a "Haliclona" marine sponge. Species of the genus "Trichoderma" are of current interest as sources of unique metabolites. The authors disclose that the saltwater culture of a sponge-derived "T. longibrachiatum​" produces D28 bisvertinoid polyketide accompanied by a new C14 vertinoid pigment, which they have named epoxysorbicilli​nol.
